page.title: 03ECOLOGY NASH/BEACHAMPTON
page.content: Agriculture of area is intensive cereal production with only small acreage of grassland and woodland. The land is subject to chemical spraying and fertilising each year which is probably main form of pollution. Small area of natural meadowland left with a variety of wild flowers and grasses. Elm was dominant tree with Ash and Oak. Most elms killed by disease leaving few trees in hedgerows. 4 small woodlands, haven for many wild mammals from voles to muntjac deer. Large and varied population of birds. Footpaths radiate to all nearby villages. There are 24 rights of way of which 2 are bridleways, these vary from local shortcuts to part of the North Bucks Way.
